posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked:
I originally posted this in the YAGSL megathread since it was part of several different issues I was troubleshooting, but since it’s not YAGSL specific I figured it would be better to start a new thread.

The auto I’m testing is a simple drive straight forward to the middle line of the field, no movement left or right. The intention is to start in the blue alliance at the far left position when facing out towards the field from the driver station. I am including an image of the auto below.

If I run the auto without using the preset starting pose checked off , auto thinks I am positioned in the blue alliance at the far right when facing toward the field from the driver station (I believe that’s 0,0 on the field, that’s the way it looks when it comes up on Shuffleboard). The bot drives straight left (I believe it’s taking me to the default position when creating a new PathPlanner path) and then moves straight forward. When viewing it on the Shuffleboard, I end up exactly where I should be according to the field position.

If I run the auto with the preset starting pose checked off and I set the preset starting pose to be at the same start position that the path is supposed to start, the robot drives backwards . When viewing the movement on Shuffleboard, it seems to think I have moved over to the red alliance and starts me in the far right position of the Red alliance when facing the field from the drivers station. It starts and finishes perfectly if I was starting in that position facing backwards and wanted to finish at the middle, still facing backwards.

It seems to think that if I use a preset starting pose, the starting pose is in the Red Alliance, not Blue. If I don’t use a preset starting pose, it thinks I’m in the Blue Alliance, but at the far right instead of where I actually position it using the path.

What also might be helpful is that driving forward, backwards, left, right all seem to map correctly to the Shuffleboard when driving in auto. But when I switch to teleop, it all flips (ie. physically moving forward with the bot makes the Shuffleboard version move backwards, moving the bot left makes the Shuffleboard version move right, etc.). All good in auto, all reversed in teleop.

image 3147×1770 199 KB

image 3147×1770 199 KB

image 3147×1770 199 KB

posts.name: Jack Pace
posts.cooked: Are you zeroing your gyro correctly and lining up your robot facing the correct way? Since PathPlanner controls movement in robot relative form, this could cause it to be backwards. Also, is your driver station set to blue or red? PathPlanner flips the paths based on that. Also, when you are on red, you still must reset your gyro as if you were on the blue side since PathPlanner is relative to the blue origin.

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked: Gyro is zeroed (done in code when initialized, so will be done whether we’re in Blue or Red). We have the bot up on a rack and we’re monitoring direction of travel using wheel motion and Shuffleboard, so there’s technically no “correct” way. Driver station is set to Blue 1.

posts.name: Asher Olgeirson
posts.cooked: Do you use any vision? If so, verify camera poses are correct.

posts.name: Jack Pace
posts.cooked: Is it possible that your AutoBuilder was not correctly configured? Maybe your flip supplier is backwards? It should be similar to this:

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked: Yes, we have that in our AutoBuilder.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
